alert.note: Alert for Chaves; Curry; De Baca; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 24 at 10:13PM MDT until May 24 at 11:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Roosevelt County in east central New Mexico... Southeastern De Baca County in east central New Mexico... North central Chaves County in southeastern New Mexico... Southwestern Curry County in east central New Mexico... * Until 1115 PM MDT. * At 1013 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 17 miles southwest of Melrose, or 24 miles west of Portales, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Portales, Fort Sumner, Melrose, Elida, Floyd, Saint Vrain, Tolar and Taiban. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 325 and 376. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
